data.title: Frederick William IV, King of Prussia (1795
data.meta_description: Frederick William IV, King of Prussia, eldest son of Frederick William III, and Queen Louise, daughter of Charles, Grand Duke of Mecklenburg-Strelitz, succeeded his father in 1840. Precariously retaining his throne during the 1848 Revolution, he suffered a stroke in 1858 and ruled under the Regency of his brother until his death in 1861. He married, in 1823, Elisabeth, daughter of Maximilian I, King of Bavaria, but died childless, leaving his brother to succeed him as William I.Minna Pf√ºller also...
